TextLang.Text: Press the %e button to save settings.
The hard disk cannot be accessed.
The Internet connection is disabled. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] and enable Internet connection.
A connection to the network could not be established. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] and check your settings.
Do you want to cancel? The settings you have made so far will not be saved if you cancel.
Adjust settings for connection to the Internet. If making a wired connection, you must have an Ethernet cable connected.
Select a connection method. If making a wired connection, you must have an Ethernet cable connected.
A connection error has occurred. Check the connection method.
An Internet connection could not be established. Check the network settings.
Select the operation mode of the network device. In most cases, select Auto-Detect.
Set the DHCP host name. In most cases this setting does not need to be changed.
The port number is invalid. Enter a number from 1 to 65535.
An Ethernet cable is not connected.
Next, adjust settings for connection to the Internet. If making a wired connection, you must have an Ethernet cable connected.
Next, adjust settings for connection to the Internet. You must have an Ethernet cable connected.
By connecting to the Internet, you can use PlayStation®Network services.
If you do not want to adjust these settings now, press the %b button.
Do you want to cancel? You can set up an Internet connection later in [Internet Connection Settings] under [Settings] > [Network Settings].

Internet connection settings have been completed.
For further enjoyment of your PS3™ system, sign up under [PlayStation®Network].
If you do not know your PPPoE user name and password, contact your Internet service provider.
The value you entered is not valid.
The characters you entered are not valid. Only ASCII characters can be used here.
The characters you entered are not valid. For hexadecimal: Use 10 or 26 characters from the ranges 0-9, a-f, and A-F For ASCII: Use 5 or 13 characters
The characters you entered are not valid. Use one of the following patterns. For hexadecimal: Use 64 characters from the ranges 0-9, a-f, and A-F For ASCII: Use from 8 to 63 characters
Do you want to perform advanced settings?
The PS3™ system will scan for the SSID of the access point. Select this option if you don't know the SSID.
Manually enter the SSID of the access point.
Automatic setup by access point type. Select when using an access point that supports wireless LAN automatic setup.
Select the access point to be used.

"Rakuraku WLAN Start" is a technology developed by NEC Access Technica, Inc. It is possible to make wireless LAN settings by using the "Rakuraku Start Button" of the Aterm® series. *Except for Aterm® series, a different operating might be necessary.
AOSS™ (AirStation One-Touch Secure System) is a technology developed by Buffalo, Inc. It is possible to make wireless LAN settings with simple, one-touch operation.
Save completed. It may take 1 minute or longer to restart the access point.
Press and hold the "AOSS Button" of the access point until the AOSS indicator starts blinking. If you don't press the button within 2 minutes, the operation will be cancelled.
It will take about 10 seconds for the access point to be ready. Please wait...
There are too many access points. Perform setup in a place where there are only a few access points.
A timeout error occurred during setup.

Press and hold the "Rakuraku Start Button" of the access point until the "POWER" LED blinks in [Green]. If you don't press the button within 1 minute, the operation will be cancelled. *Please see the manual of the product appending, about the connection method of the product without "Rakuraku Start Button".

Press the "Rakuraku Start Button" again. Press and hold until the "POWER" LED turns [Orange]. If you don't press the button within 30 seconds, the operation will be cancelled. *Please see the manual of the product appending, about the connection method of the product without "Rakuraku Start Button".
The PS3™ system does not support the security method of this access point.
If you perform a connection test, the current connection will be terminated and the system will be disconnected. Do you want to continue?
* Connection speed results are estimates and are provided as a reference only.
A connection to the access point could not be established. Check the security settings for the wireless LAN.
A connection to the access point could not be established. Check the security settings for the wireless LAN.
The attempt to obtain the IP address timed out. The WEP key you entered may not be correct.
The attempt to obtain the IP address timed out. The WEP key you entered may not be correct.
The key information exchange timed out. The WPA key you entered may not be correct.
The key information exchange timed out. The WPA key you entered may not be correct.
The access point was not detected. The signal of the access point may be weak or the SSID you entered may not be correct.
The access point was not detected. The signal of the access point may be weak or the SSID you entered may not be correct.
The connection to the server timed out.
The connection with PlayStation®Network timed out.
There was a PPPoE communication error.
A PPPoE server was not detected.
You have been disconnected from the PPPoE server.
The PPPoE server returned an error.
The PPPoE user name or password is not correct.
There was a DHCP communication error.
A DHCP server was not detected.
You have been disconnected from the access point.
A connection error has occurred. Please try again.
The connection to the access point timed out.
The key information exchange timed out.
The attempt to obtain an IP address timed out.
The access point was not detected.
When the NAT type is type 3, chat or the communication features of games may be restricted. For more information, refer to the online instruction manual.
The router in use may not support IP fragments, and the communication features of some games may be restricted. For details, contact the router manufacturer.
An error occurred during communication with the server. This is a DNS error.
An error occurred during communication with the server. This is a DNS error.
The sign-in ID (e-mail address) or password is incorrect.
An error occurred during automatic sign-in. The sign-in ID (e-mail address) or password is incorrect.
You cannot sign in using another user's sign-in ID (e-mail address).
Another user with the same online ID has signed in. You have been signed out.
An error has occurred. You have been signed out of PlayStation®Network.
PlayStation®Network is busy. Try to sign in again later.
A system software update is required. Go to [Settings] > [System Update] and perform the update.
A system software update is required. Go to [Settings] > [System Update] and perform the update.
You cannot use PlayStation®Network with this account.
You must select [PlayStation®Network] > [Sign In] and sign in to continue using PlayStation®Network.
Communication with the server timed out.
The following characters cannot be entered: %1
